info.name: Subthalamic nucleus
info.description: The subthalamic nucleus is a bi-convex lens-shaped nucleus located just medial and superior to the junction of the internal capsule and crus cerebri. The subthalamic nucleus is part of an indirect route through the basal ganglia whereby it receives input from the external segment of the globus pallidus and returns it output to the internal segment of the globus pallidus. Damage to the subthalamic nucleus produces hemiballismus on the contralateral side of the body.
